title: Who is smartest physicist ever? - Quora

response.answer_text: Without comparable data, we cannot say with any certainty who was the smartest (defined by IQ) physicist. We can, however, with some certainty say who the most influential physicist was. There are a few candidates—I would name Galileo, Newton, Maxwell, Einstein, and Bohr as possibilities. Galileo stands out in experimental physics (and observational astronomy); Maxwell’s work in electromagnetism underlies modern technological civilization; Einstein’s work influenced quantum mechanics and expanded and generalized the Newtonian view of the universe; and Bohr’s interpretation of quantum mechanics remains highly influential. However, it is impossible not to give Newton top billing. The Newtonian theories of dynamics and gravitation still describe our day to day experience of the universe, and his work in mathematics in discovering the calculus (Leibnitz did it independently at the same time) enabled us to describe physical law in an elegant and compact way. He laid the foundations for the science of optics. If that were not enough, he founded the Royal Society and ran the Royal Mint. It is impossible to imagine how Western science and thought would have progressed without Newton.
